J	Quevedo, H; Quevedo, MN				Quevedo, Hernando; Quevedo, Maria N.			Geometrothermodynamic approach in econophysics	INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF GEOMETRIC METHODS IN MODERN PHYSICS			English	Article; Early Access						Economic systems; thermodynamics; econophysics; geometrothermo- dynamics	STATISTICAL-MECHANICS; WEALTH; INCOME; MONEY; SYSTEMS	The formalism of geometrothermodynamics has been developed to describe the properties of thermodynamic systems in terms of concepts of differential geometry. On the other hand, in econophysics, it is argued that under certain conditions the behavior of economic systems can be described by using the laws of classical thermodynamics. These two results are used in this work to propose a geometric description of economic systems. We obtain as a result that most systems can be described by two different geometries corresponding to the Boltzmann-Gibbs and Pareto distributions, which represent two different population groups that are usually present in most economic systems. The geometrothermodynamic analysis shows that no phase transitions are present in the Boltzmann-Gibbs sector, whereas the Pareto sector is characterized by a strong thermodynamic interaction that leads to the appearance of a rich phase transition structure. We argue that those phase transitions could be interpreted as financial crises.	[Quevedo, Hernando] Univ Nacl Autonoma Mexico, Inst Ciencias Nucl, AP 70543, Ciudad De Mexico 04510, Mexico; [Quevedo, Hernando] Univ Roma La Sapienza, Dipartimento Fis & ICRA, I-00185 Rome, Italy; [Quevedo, Maria N.] Univ Mil Nueva Granada, Fac Ciencias Basicas, Dept Matemat, Cra 11 101-80, Bogota, Colombia	Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico; Sapienza University Rome; Universidad Militar Nueva Granada	Quevedo, H (corresponding author), Univ Nacl Autonoma Mexico, Inst Ciencias Nucl, AP 70543, Ciudad De Mexico 04510, Mexico.; Quevedo, H (corresponding author), Univ Roma La Sapienza, Dipartimento Fis & ICRA, I-00185 Rome, Italy.	quevedo@nucleares.unam.mx; maria.quevedo@unimilitar.edu.co			Vicerrectoria de Investigaciones de la Universidad Militar Nueva Granada - Vigencia 2018 [CIAS 2546]; UNAM-DGAPA-PAPIIT [114520]; Conacyt-Mexico [A1-S-31269]	Vicerrectoria de Investigaciones de la Universidad Militar Nueva Granada - Vigencia 2018; UNAM-DGAPA-PAPIIT(Programa de Apoyo a Proyectos de Investigacion e Innovacion Tecnologica (PAPIIT)Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico); Conacyt-Mexico(Consejo Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnologia (CONACyT))	This work was carried out within the scope of the project CIAS 2546 supported by the Vicerrectoria de Investigaciones de la Universidad Militar Nueva Granada - Vigencia 2018. J	Christina, S; Singh, TI; Meitei, IA				Christina, S.; Singh, T. Ibungochouba; Meitei, I. Ablu			Modified Hawking temperatures of black holes in Lorentz violation theory	INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF GEOMETRIC METHODS IN MODERN PHYSICS			English	Article; Early Access						Hawking radiation; Klein-Gordon equation; Bekenstein-Hawking entropy; Lorentz violation theory in curved space time; ether-like vector	TUNNELING RADIATION; CHARGED-PARTICLES; STATIONARY	In this paper, the tunneling of scalar particles near the event horizons of Riemann space time, BTZ black hole and Schwarzschild-de Sitter black hole are investigated by applying Hamilton-Jacobi equation with Lorentz violation theory in curved space time. The modified Hamilton Jacobi equation is derived from Klein Gordon equation of scalar particles induced by Lorentz violation theory in curved space time. The Hawking temperatures of Riemann space time and the BTZ black hole are modified due to the effect of Lorentz violation theory. Moreover, the Bekenstein-Hawking entropy near the event horizon of Schwarzschild-de Sitter black hole is also modified due to Lorentz violation theory. It is observed that the modified values of Hawking temperatures and change in Bekenstein-Hawking entropy depend upon the ether-like vectors u(alpha).	[Christina, S.; Singh, T. Ibungochouba] Manipur Univ, Dept Math, Imphal West, Manipur, India; [Meitei, I. J	Godani, N				Godani, Nisha			Wormhole solutions in f(R, T) = R plus alpha R-2 + beta ln T gravity	INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF GEOMETRIC METHODS IN MODERN PHYSICS			English	Article; Early Access						Wormholes; energy density; f (R, T) gravity; energy conditions	BRANS-DICKE WORMHOLES; MODIFIED GRAVITY; INFLATION; ENERGY; MATTER	In this paper, the Morris-Thorne wormholes are studied in the background of f (R, T) = R + alpha R-2 + beta ln T gravity, where alpha and beta are constants. The wormhole solutions are derived in two cases with different assumptions for the matter forms. In each case, the null energy condition (NEC) is analyzed and the range of parameters satisfying the NEC are determined. Further, the stability of solutions is examined with the help of the generalized Tolman-Oppenheimer-Volkoff (TOV) equation.
